page.title: 04Farming in Sebergham
page.content: Milk production is almost exclusively confined to Fresian herds though the Holstein is gaining in pop- ularity. The milk cows are mainly put to beef bulls to produce calves for sale to those who rear them for beef. All milking is now by machine and milk is collected by bulk tanker. In the past two years farmers have run a few more suckler cows producing beef animals and more sheep are now kept for the lambs which are sold in May or September at the local markets. Both suckler cows and sheep have increased due to the introduction of government imposed milk quotas as there is a European surplus of milk. The land is heavily fertilised with nitrogen based chemical fertilisers for a better growth of grass cut for silage in June and August. Some hay is made but only for calves and sheep.
